page.title: 05STAPLOW AND SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: This country area is mainly used for arable farming - hops and to a lesser degree fruit growing. It includes one small hamlet,{Staplow,}of approx. 14 houses and an Inn (Free House). Otherwise, housing is scarce and scattered. The{main problems}raised in the area were the decrease in acreage of hops and soft fruit.{The decrease in hops is due to the effect of the breathalyser, the miners strike of 1984-85, high unemployment, changes in the EEC policy, but basically to high mechanisation with harvesting, producing a higher yield.{The decrease {in fruit growing}is due to the high cost of labour (pickers) and again EEC Policy. This in turn has decreased the number of customers at the Inn.
